text:
Hi everyone,

I am building an app locally and making use of Private App and the API documentation that exists. What I want to achieve is to pull all tickets created or updated today and sync them to my local DB every day.

The number of tickets we have on HubSpot is large, and trying to pull all tickets daily is not sustainable. I prefer a situation whereby I can pull all and sync the tickets created or updated per day at the end of that day to my local DB. How can I limit the returned data by the date created or the date updated?

The referenced API is GET /crm-objects/v1/objects/tickets/paged


<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/tickets/get-all-tickets>
<@U06HYRUU06A> I found an alternate solution to this issue, using the lists/search POST endpoint

Hi everyone! *Do you know if there is a way to delete custom behavioral event completions?* One of my clients imported a lot of custom event completions with this endpoint, but without a date, and they want to delete all of those completions to re-imported with the date.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/analytics/events>
I don't think so. For creating a clean slate, I've had to create a new custom event type to reset

Is it possible via the HubSpot APIs to get ALL ‘Activities’ from a Records middle column - e.g. marketing and sales emails, notes, calls, meetings, tasks, SMS, LinkedIn messages, workflow enrollment/completed, list inclusions, etc. etc.?

I see there is the CRM Engagements API and the CRM Timeline Events API, but I’m not 100% sure if this gives access to everything. Thanks!.
Hi everyone, is it possible to query setter owner and get lists of leads assigned on that setter owner?
Interesting...what do you mean by "setter owner"?
